subject: RE: [junit] Listening for after a parameterized instance run...
msgSnippet: A parameterized test performs like building a suite of multiple instances of your test class, each with different parameters. (That you supply.) What I want is
messageBody:
A parameterized test performs like building a suite of multiple
instances of your test class, each with different parameters. (That you
supply.) What I want is to run a specific method after each run of a
parameterized instance of the "suite".



Interesting. I can take this conversation off-line if there is a
document somewhere that better explains this, but how is a parameterized
test different from running the same function over and over on different
test data that is defined in each test? Does it run all the test
functions on this single parameterized instance and report on them as a
group? Is parameterization simply a method of compacting code and
reporting by treating tests as parameterized groups rather than
independent functions exploded out to cover each parameterized case?



Thank you,


Rocco



From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
Forsberg, Mike
Sent: Tuesday, March 24, 2009 4:22 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] Listening for after a parameterized instance run...



Well the problem is that @AfterClass runs after the entire class runs.
Not after each parameterized test.

A parameterized test performs like building a suite of multiple
instances of your test class, each with different parameters. (That you
supply.) What I want is to run a specific method after each run of a
parameterized instance of the "suite".

I've implemented a solution, and it is at
http://github.com/bigmikef/junit. It adds @BeforeParameterize and
@AfterParameterize to the Parameterized class. These methods are called
as expected during a Parameterized run.

It would be awesome if the owners included it in JUnit. I've already
requested a pull, but have not heard anything after that.

Thanks for the help,

Big Mike

From: junit@yahoogroups.com <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com> [mailto:
junit@yahoogroups.com <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com> ] On Behalf Of
Pigneri, Rocco
Sent: Tuesday, March 24, 2009 9:16 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com>
Subject: RE: [junit] Listening for after a parameterized instance run...

As you can see, I'd like to run both test methods with varying data,
changing the run times for each. This will generate a table of data
that I then can analyze and chart. The key thing I'd like to avoid is
using @After, and only print only after the tests have ran. (Doing
something like a boolean for each test, and a giant "and" statement VERY
BAD)

I am unfortunately not familiar with Parameterized runs, but it sounds
like what you want to do could be easily accomplished with the
@AfterClass attribute. Or am I not understanding your situation fully?

Rocco

From: junit@yahoogroups.com <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com>
<mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com>
[mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com>
<mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com> ] On
Behalf Of
Forsberg, Mike
Sent: Thursday, March 19, 2009 4:15 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com>
<mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com>
Subject: [junit] Listening for after a parameterized instance run...

First, I'd like to say great group. I hope to respond to some questions
once I find one that I know the answer too.

On to my question,

Is there a way to listen to an event after a parameterized instance
runs?

What I'm doing might be better described with code...

@RunWith(Parameterized.class)

public class MyTest {

private static Map<String, Long> times = new HashMap<String, Long>();

public MyTest(Integer x, Integer y, Integer runs) {

this.x = x;

this.y = y;

this.runs = runs;

}

@Parameters

public static Collection permutations() {

return Arrays.asList(new Object[][] {

{1, 1, 1},

{1, 1, 10}

{1, 1, 100}

{1, 1, 1000},

.. . // vary x and y for each value of runs

});

}

@Test

public void useAlgX() {

//alg that uses x for runs number of runs

//add timing information to times

}

@Test

public void useAlgY() {

//alg that uses y for runs number of runs

//add timing information to times

}

@AfterParameterizedInstance

public void showParameterInsanceResults() {

//print time information in line for this run.

}

}

As you can see, I'd like to run both test methods with varying data,
changing the run times for each. This will generate a table of data
that I then can analyze and chart. The key thing I'd like to avoid is
using @After, and only print only after the tests have ran. (Doing
something like a boolean for each test, and a giant "and" statement VERY
BAD)

I'll be happy for any help you can render,

Big Mike

Mike Forsberg

Factory Automation Engineer II
